translated: the conditioned arising of the eye and form is not observed as either with signs or signless,🔽as either with conceptualization or without conceptualization,🔽as either empty or not empty,🔽as either with wishes or without wishes,

original: mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so //🔽de la mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba nyid kyang med na /
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so // de la mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba nyid kyang med na /
translated: as either calm or not calm,🔽as either afflicted or purified,🔽as either arising or ceasing,

original: rtag pa'am mi rtag pa lta ga la yod ces ston te /
analyzed: rtag pa'am mi rtag pa lta ga la yod ces ston te /
translated: as either decreasing or increasing.

original: koo shi ka /🔽de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka / de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Kauśika,🔽those sons of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni /
translated: daughters of a good family who teach that

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi ston to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi ston to //
translated: do not teach a counterfeit perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar ston te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar ston te /
translated: further, those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family teach this perfection of wisdom to those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle like this:

original: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu @88a *//🔽phyin pa sgoms shig /
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu @88a *//🔽phyin pa sgoms shig /
translated: ‘Come here, son of a good family! You should cultivate the perfection of wisdom.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su ma lta zhig /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su ma lta zhig /
translated: Do not look upon the feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the ear as permanent!

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni /🔽rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni / rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: The feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the ear🔽is empty of the nature of the feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the ear.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The nature of the feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the ear

original: dngos po med pa'o //🔽dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'o // dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: is non-apprehensible.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: That which is non-apprehensible is not the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni /🔽rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor brtag ces bya ba'am /🔽mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so //🔽de la rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba nyid kyang med na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor brtag ces bya ba'am / mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so // de la rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba nyid kyang med na /
translated: In the perfection of wisdom

original: rtag pa'am mi rtag pa lta ga la yod ces ston te /
analyzed: rtag pa'am mi rtag pa lta ga la yod ces ston te /
translated: the designation of the feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the ear as permanent or impermanent is not apprehended.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni /
analyzed: de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni /
translated: Those sons and daughters of good lineage who teach in that way🔽

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi ston to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi ston to //
translated: Those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who teach the transcendent perfection of wisdom in that manner do not teach a counterfeit transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika!

original: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar ston te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar ston te /
translated: “Moreover, Kauśika, those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage should reveal to those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who follow the vehicle of the bodhisattvas this transcendent perfection of wisdom:

original: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig /
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig /
translated: ‘Come here, son of enlightened heritage! You should cultivate the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su ma lta zhig /
analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su ma lta zhig /
translated: Do not consider that the sensory element of the nose, the sensory element of odors, and the sensory element of olfactory consciousness are permanent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni /
analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni /
translated: The sensory element of the nose, the sensory element of odors, and the sensory element of olfactory consciousness

original: rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: are empty of inherent existence.

original: sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The inherent existence of the sensory element of the nose, the sensory element of odors, and the sensory element of olfactory consciousness

original: @88b dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: @88b dngos po med pa'o //
translated: is non-apprehensible.

original: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: is the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni /
translated: In that perfection of wisdom

original: sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rtag ces bya ba'am /

original: mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so //

translated: to those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who will hold, maintain, recite aloud, master, and be attentive to this transcendent perfection of wisdom in the right manner, they will teach this transcendent perfection of wisdom as follows:

original: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig /

original: rang bzhin gyis stong ste /🔽ma rig pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong ste / ma rig pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /
translated: If you ask why, it is because ignorance is empty of inherent nature.

analyzed: dngos po med pa'o // dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The inherent nature of ignorance is non-entity.🔽That which is a non-entity is the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de pa ni /🔽ma rig pa rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de pa ni / ma rig pa rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: That which is the transcendent perfection of wisdom is neither permanent nor impermanent.

original: mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so //🔽de la ma rig pa nyid kyang med na /
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so // de la ma rig pa nyid kyang med na /
translated: The transcendent perfection of wisdom is not perceived as either permanent or impermanent.

original: rtag pa'am mi rtag pa lta ga la yod ces ston te /
analyzed: rtag pa'am mi rtag pa lta ga la yod ces ston te /
translated: If ignorance itself does not exist, how could there be anything permanent or impermanent?’

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika!

original: de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni /
analyzed: de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni /
translated: Those sons and daughters of good lineage who teach in that way🔽

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi ston to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi ston to //
translated: Those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who teach the transcendent perfection of wisdom in that manner do not teach a counterfeit transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka /🔽gzhan yang rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg ba pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar ston te /

translated: Kauśika!

original: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig /
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig /
translated: “Moreover, Kauśika, those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage teach the transcendent perfection of wisdom to those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who follow the vehicle of the bodhisattvas, saying, ‘Come here, you son of enlightened heritage! You should cultivate the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: 'du byed mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su ma lta zhig /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'du byed ni /
analyzed: 'du byed mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su ma lta zhig / de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'du byed ni /
translated: Do not consider that formative predispositions are impermanent!

original: rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: If you ask why, it is because formative predispositions are empty of inherent existence.

original: 'du byed kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The inherent existence of formative predispositions

original: dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'o //
translated: is non-apprehensible.

original: dngos po med pa @92b gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: dngos po med pa @92b gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which is non-apprehensible

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: is the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni /🔽'du byed rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni / 'du byed rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: In that perfection of wisdom

original: mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so //
translated: the impermanence or permanence of volitional factors is not apprehended.

analyzed: reg pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni / dngos po med pa'o //
translated: The nature of contact is non-apprehensible.🔽What is non-apprehensible does not exist.

analyzed: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: What does not exist is non-apprehensible.🔽And that which is the perfection of wisdom is non-apprehensible.

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni / reg pa rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: In the perfection of wisdom one does not apprehend a form that is permanent or impermanent,🔽or that is suffering or happiness, or that is self or not self, or that is empty or not empty, or that is with signs or signless, or that has wishes or is wishless, or that is calm or not calm, or that is empty or not empty, or that is isolated or not isolated.

original: mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so //🔽de la reg pa nyid kyang med na /
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so // de la reg pa nyid kyang med na /
translated: In the perfection of wisdom one does not apprehend a feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness that is permanent or impermanent,

original: rtag pa'am mi rtag pa lta ga la yod ces ston te /
analyzed: rtag pa'am mi rtag pa lta ga la yod ces ston te /
translated: or that is suffering or happiness, or that is self or not self, or that is empty or not empty, or that has signs or is signless, or that has wishes or is wishless, or that is calm or not calm, or that is empty or not empty, or that is isolated or not isolated.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni /

translated: Moreover, those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage should present this transcendent perfection of wisdom to those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who follow the vehicle of the bodhisattvas in the following manner:

translated: Moreover, those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage teach this transcendent perfection of wisdom to those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who follow the vehicle of the bodhisattvas, saying:

analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig /

analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su ma zhig / de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'dus byas stong pa nyid ni /
translated: Do not conceive that the emptiness of compounded things is permanent!

original: rang bzhin gyis stong ste /🔽'dus byas stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /🔽dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong ste / 'dus byas stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni / dngos po med pa'o //
translated: If you ask why, it is because the emptiness of compounded things is empty of the emptiness of compounded things.

original: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni /🔽shes @100b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni / shes @100b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The emptiness of compounded things is not one thing and emptiness another.🔽The emptiness of compounded things is not one thing and the transcendent perfection of wisdom another.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni /🔽'dus byas stong pa nyid rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni / 'dus byas stong pa nyid rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: The transcendent perfection of wisdom is not one thing and the emptiness of compounded things another.🔽Therefore, son of enlightened heritage, the emptiness of compounded things is not the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so //
translated: In the transcendent perfection of wisdom, the notion that the emptiness of compounded things is permanent or that it is impermanent is not apprehended.

original: de la 'dus byas stong pa nyid kyang med na /
analyzed: de la 'dus byas stong pa nyid kyang med na /

translated: how could there be anything permanent or impermanent?

translated: “Kauśika,

analyzed: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni /

original: mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so //

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /

analyzed: de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i @101a *//

You should cultivate the transcendent perfection of wisdom.🔽Do not consider the emptiness of the extremes to be impermanent!

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su ma lta zhig /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid ni /

original: rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: The emptiness of the extremes is empty of the emptiness of the extremes.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni /
translated: That which is the transcendent perfection of wisdom🔽is not permanent, nor is it impermanent;🔽it is not happiness, nor is it suffering;

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: it is not self, nor is it selfless;🔽it is not endowed with the eyes, nor is it devoid of the eyes;🔽it is not endowed with the ears, nor is it devoid of the ears;🔽it is not endowed with the nose, nor is it devoid of the nose;🔽it is not endowed with the tongue, nor is it devoid of the tongue;🔽it is not endowed with the body, nor is it devoid of the body;🔽it is not endowed with the mental faculty, nor is it devoid of the mental faculty;🔽it is not endowed with forms, nor is it devoid of forms;🔽it is not endowed with sounds, nor is it devoid of sounds;🔽it is not endowed with odors, nor is it devoid of odors;🔽it is not endowed with tastes, nor is it devoid of tastes;🔽it is not endowed with tangibles, nor is it devoid of tangibles;🔽it is not endowed with mental phenomena, nor is it devoid of mental phenomena;🔽it is not endowed with the eyes, nor is it devoid of the eyes;🔽it is not endowed with the ears, nor is it devoid of the ears;🔽it is not endowed with the nose, nor is it devoid of the nose;🔽it is not endowed with the tongue, nor is it devoid of the tongue;🔽it is not endowed with the body, nor is it devoid of the body;🔽it is not endowed with the mental faculty, nor is it devoid of the mental faculty;🔽it is not endowed with the sensory element of the eyes, nor is it devoid of the sensory element of the eyes;🔽it is not endowed with the sensory element

original: mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so //
translated: “Impermanent” is not observed.

original: de la mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyang med na /
analyzed: de la mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyang med na /

analyzed: rtag pa'am mi rtag pa lta ga la yod ces ston te /
translated: how could “permanent” or “impermanent” exist?

original: koo shi ka /

translated: “Moreover, Kauśika, those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family teach this perfection of wisdom to those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle like this:

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong ste /

translated: In that perfection of wisdom, the emptiness that is the emptiness of no beginning and no end is not apprehended as either a real or an unreal entity.

translated: do not teach a counterfeit perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su ma lta zhig /

original: dngos po med pa'o //

analyzed: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang @112a *//
translated: That perfection of wisdom

analyzed: yin pa de la ni /
translated: is not a thing.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams rtag ces bya ba'am mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams rtag ces bya ba'am mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so //
translated: The emptiness of non-apprehension is not observed as the emptiness of non-apprehension, and the emptiness of the beginningless and endless is not observed as the emptiness of the beginningless and endless.🔽The emptiness of what is not to be discarded is not observed as the emptiness of what is not to be discarded, and the emptiness of essential nature is not observed as the emptiness of essential nature.

original: de la so so yang dag par rig pa nyid kyang med na /
analyzed: de la so so yang dag par rig pa nyid kyang med na /
translated: The emptiness of all things is not observed as the emptiness of all things, and the emptiness of individual characteristics is not observed as the emptiness of individual characteristics.

original: rtag pa'am mi rtag pa lta ga la yod ces ston te /🔽koo shi ka /🔽de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni /
analyzed: rtag pa'am mi rtag pa lta ga la yod ces ston te / koo shi ka / de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni /
translated: The emptiness of non-apprehension is not observed as the emptiness of non-apprehension, and the emptiness of the beginningless and endless is not observed as the emptiness of the beginningless and endless.🔽The emptiness of what is not to be discarded is not observed as the emptiness of what is not to be discarded, and the emptiness of essential nature is not observed as the emptiness of essential nature.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi ston to //🔽koo shi ka /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi ston to // koo shi ka /
translated: The emptiness of all things is not observed as the emptiness of all things, and the emptiness of individual characteristics is not observed as the emptiness of individual characteristics.🔽The emptiness of non-apprehension is not observed as the emptiness of non-apprehension, and the emptiness of the beginningless and endless is not observed as the emptiness of the beginningless and endless.

original: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar ston te; tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi🔽pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig /
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar ston te; tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig /
translated: The emptiness of what is not to be discarded is not observed as the emptiness of what is not to be discarded, and the emptiness of essential nature is not observed as the emptiness of essential nature.🔽The emptiness of all things is not observed as the emptiness of all things, and the emptiness of individual characteristics is not observed as the emptiness of individual characteristics.

original: snying rje chen po mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su ma lta zhig /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: snying rje chen po mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su ma lta zhig /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The emptiness of non-apprehension is not observed as the emptiness of non-apprehension, and the emptiness of the beginningless and endless is not observed as the emptiness of the beginningless and endless.🔽The emptiness of what is not to be discarded is not observed as the emptiness of what is not to be discarded, and the emptiness of essential nature is not observed as the emptiness of essential nature.🔽The emptiness of all things is not observed as the emptiness of all things

original: snying rje chen po ni; rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po ni; rang bzhin gyis stong ste /

analyzed: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni /

analyzed: snying rje chen po rtag ces bya ba'am mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so //

original: de la snying rje chen po nyid kyang med na /
analyzed: de la snying rje chen po nyid kyang med na /

analyzed: rtag pa'am mi rtag pa lta ga la yod ces ston te /

original: koo shi ka /

translated: Kauśika,

translated: Moreover, those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage should reveal this transcendent perfection of wisdom to those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who follow the vehicle of the bodhisattvas, saying:

analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su ma lta zhig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: Moreover, a son or daughter of good lineage who explains this perfection of wisdom to others in detail, teaches it, demonstrates it, elucidates it, analyzes it, illuminates it, and perfectly shows it, saying, Come here, son of good lineage! You should take up the perfection of wisdom!🔽

original: kun chub par gyis shig /🔽chongs shig / lhogs shig /
analyzed: kun chub par gyis shig / chongs shig / lhogs shig /
translated: Moreover, if a son of good lineage or a daughter of good lineage were to teach this perfection of wisdom to others in detail, were to explain it, were to reveal it, were to announce it, were to expound it, were to expound it in detail, were to make it clear, were to make it clear in detail, and were to say, Come here, son of good lineage! You should take up the perfection of wisdom!🔽You should master it!🔽You should bear it in mind!

analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la gyis shig / ji ltar bstan pa'i @123a *//
